intro: Cacalia volubilis, commonly known as the creeping bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open woodlands and grassy areas. The plant features slender, trailing stems that can root at the nodes, allowing it to spread along the ground. Its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
